content.description: Start at the base of the lip of the overhang and climb up through the crack, topping out on the opposite side of the cave. Basically the reverse of 300.

This problem is about 80 feet uphill from the 300 Boulder, near the stream and waterfall. 

  Start on a huge flake and follow perfect edges out a steep face/arete.  Set up on a pebbly sloper then toss for the top.
content.location: From the 300 Boulder, walk uphill and towards the stream for about 1 minute.  The problem is located below a small waterfall with a brick pillar under an overhang.

content.description:
One of the best roof problems ever!  Cool holds, crazy geometry, feet-first roof moves, and two beta intensive exits.    

  Sit down start on a strange sloper, big moves gain a good flake in the roof.  Down climb along the flake until you can reach around the roof. 

  If you like slopers, head left.  If you prefer edges, go right.  Both are the some grade.
content.protection: At least two pads. A kneepad is helpful.

content.description: Starting on the big sloper at the base of the lip, climb out right towards the river using some cool compression features. Then follow the face up for a relatively easy topout. This is basically doing the right variation version of 300 in isolation.
content.location: Starts on the big sloper at the base of the lip. 300 cave.

content.description: A lone boulder high on the hill.  Get ready for some tricky roof climbing on crazy angles.
